text: Former development regions of Nepal This is a list of former development regions of Nepal (until 2015) by Human Development Index as of 2018 with data for the year 2017. {| class="wikitable" !Rank !Region (Zones) !2017 HDI !Comparable country (2017) |- ! colspan="4" style="color:#fc0;" |Medium human development |- |1 |Western (Gandaki, Lumbini, Dhaulagiri) |0.597 | |- |2 |Central (Janakpu, Bagmati, Narayani) |0.577 | |- style="background:#e6e6e6" |– | (average) |0.574 | |- |3 |Eastern (Mechi, Kosi, Sagarmatha) |0.572 | |- ! colspan="4" style="color:#900;" |Low human development |- |4 |Far-Western (Seti, Mahakali) |0.549 | |- |5 |Mid-Western (Rapti, Bheri, Karnali) |0.548 | |} == See also == * List of countries by Human Development Index == References == Human Development Index Nepal Nepal
title: List of regions of Nepal by Human Development Index
